intro: Ipomoea purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, with heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that help it ascend supports. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, giving it its common name. Ipomoea purpusii is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its beauty.
